header.title: wxFontPickerCtrl

description.p: This control allows the user to select a font. The generic implementation is a button which brings up a wxFontDialog when clicked. Native implementation may differ but this is usually a (small) widget which give access to the font-chooser dialog. It is only available if wxUSE_FONTPICKERCTRL is set to 1 (the default).

desc.p: Sets the maximum point size value allowed for the user-chosen font.

The default value is 100. Note that big fonts can require a lot of memory and CPU time both for creation and for rendering; thus, specially because the user has the option to specify the fontsize through a text control (see wxFNTP_USE_TEXTCTRL), it's a good idea to put a limit to the maximum font size when huge fonts do not make much sense.
